Microservice Roadmap Creating a roadmap for implementing microservices architecture involves several key phases and considerations.Microservice RoadmapPhase 1: Assessment and Planning1.Understand Business Goals:✅️Identify the business objectives that the microservices architecture will support.✅️Engage stakeholders to gather requirements and expectations.2.Evaluate Current Architecture:✅️Assess the existing system architecture.✅️Identify pain points and limitations of the monolithic system.3.Define Success Metrics:✅️Establish KPIs to measure the success of the microservices implementation.4.Skill Assessment:✅️Evaluate the current team’s skills in microservices, DevOps, and cloud technologies.✅️Identify training needs or hiring requirements.Phase 2: Design and Strategy5.Define Service Boundaries:✅️Identify logical boundaries for microservices based on business capabilities.✅️Use domain-driven design (DDD) principles to guide service decomposition.6.Select Technology Stack:✅️Choose appropriate languages, frameworks, and tools for developing microservices.✅️Consider containerization (e.g., Docker), orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes), and cloud platforms.7.Design APIs:✅️Define API contracts (REST, gRPC, GraphQL) for communication between services.✅️Ensure APIs are versioned and follow best practices.8.Establish Data Management Strategy:✅️Decide on data ownership for each service.✅️Choose between shared databases and database per service patterns.Phase 3: Development and Implementation9.Set Up CI/CD Pipeline:✅️Implement continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines for automating builds and deployments.10.Develop Microservices:✅️Start building microservices iteratively, focusing on high-priority services first.✅️Follow best practices for coding, testing, and documentation.11.Implement Service Discovery:✅️Choose a service discovery mechanism (e.g., Eureka, Consul) to facilitate communication between services.12.Establish Monitoring and Logging:✅️Implement centralized logging (e.g., ELK Stack) and monitoring (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana) for observability.Phase 4: Testing and Quality Assurance13.Automated Testing:✅️Develop unit, integration, and contract tests for microservices.✅️Implement service virtualization for testing inter-service interactions.14.Load and Performance Testing:✅️Conduct load testing to ensure services can handle expected traffic.15.Security Assessment:✅️Implement security best practices, including API security (OAuth2, JWT) and service-to-service authentication.💡Ultimately, successful microservices implementation is not just about technology but also about aligning with business goals, fostering a collaborative culture, and continuously improving processes.Want to know more? ویدئو آموزشی به زبان فارسی و انگیسی را در کانال یوتوپ من دنبال کنید:https://lnkd.in/dcswikYbYou can also access the source code just here👇🔔🔔🔔https://lnkd.in/dCCgZ2JS🔆Sequential Execution🔆Pros:✅ Simple to understand✅ Practical execution order✅ Easy error handlingCons:❌ Slower overall execution❌ Waste potential parallel processing time❌ Each task must wait for previous completion🔆Parallel Execution🔆Pros:✅ Significantly faster overall execution✅ Tasks run concurrently✅ Better resource utilizationCons:❌ More complex error handling❌ Less control over execution order❌ Higher memory usage during concurrent execution💡When using Task.WhenAll, if any task throws an exception, it propagates to the await point. This pattern allows you to handle exceptions from multiple tasks while maintaining proper async behavior.Asynchronous methods are better for I/O-bound operations, while simple methods are suitable for CPU-bound tasks.You can have the experience of developing this pattern here just on my 💎YouTube channel👇🔔🔔🔔https://lnkd.in/dMxGSjA5hashtaghashtag#programming hashtaghashtag#learntocode hashtaghashtag#csharpproject hashtaghashtag#dotnet hashtaghashtag#async hashtaghashtag#await hashtaghashtag#csharp hashtaghashtag#coding hashtaghashtag#cancellation hashtaghashtag#cancellations hashtaghashtag#cancellationtoken hashtaghashtag#token hashtaghashtag#tokens hashtaghashtag#github hashtaghashtag#dotnet hashtaghashtag#aspnetcore hashtaghashtag#cleancodehashtag#taskhashtag#awaithashtag#async

### How to Easily Get a Remote Job Online The demand for remote jobs is skyrocketing! 🏡💻 If you want to earn well while working from home, following a few key strategies can help you succeed. ✅ **Develop the Right Skills** – Learn in-demand remote skills like graphic design, content writing, web development, digital marketing, or video editing. ✅ **Create a Professional Profile** – Build an attractive profile on platforms like LinkedIn, Upwork, Fiverr, and PeoplePerHour. Clearly highlight your experience and skills. ✅ **Network Effectively** – Networking is crucial for landing remote jobs. Stay active on LinkedIn, connect with industry experts, and share relevant posts. ✅ **Start with Small Projects** – Take on small projects initially, deliver quality work, and gradually increase your rates as you gain experience. ✅ **Maintain Professionalism** – Deliver work on time, build strong relationships with clients, and be open to feedback. 🎯 Start your remote job search today—your dream job might be waiting for you! 🚨 Job Offer or Scam? Beware of This Email Tactic!🚨 I recently received an email from Jennifer Brown offering me an internship or entry-level job opportunity. It seemed legitimate at first—they asked for my resume, reviewed it, and then rejected me. But what followed exposed the real motive behind this scheme!🔹 Jennifer emailed me again, saying, "Your resume was rejected due to a low ATS score, but I can connect you with someone who can improve it."🔹 When I agreed, she directed me to a Fiverr profile where I could "fix" my resume—for a price!🔹 This wasn’t the first time! A few weeks ago, I received a similar email from another person. I even reached out to their Fiverr contact, only to realize they were just selling paid resume reviews for $5–$10.This time, before I could fall for it again, I came across a LinkedIn post by Sarthak Mittal (CEO) exposing this scam (even the screenshot uploaded by Sarthak Mittal and the email I received have the same content written). That’s when it all clicked!⚠ Red Flags to Watch For:🚨 A rejection email followed by a paid service pitch.🚨 Being told your ATS score is too low and offered "help" for a fee.🚨 Recruiters redirecting you to Fiverr or paid platforms.🚨 Different names but the same tactics and email formats.💡 Lesson Learned? Never pay for job applications or resume fixes unless you’ve done your own research! There are plenty of free AI tools to improve your resume. Don’t let scammers profit off your job search struggles.Have you received similar emails? Let’s spread awareness and expose these scams together! Share your experiences in the comments. 🔍💬hashtag#EmailScam hashtag#JobScam hashtag#ScamAlert hashtag#CareerFraud hashtag#ResumeScam hashtag#ATSScam hashtag#StayAware hashtag#LinkedInCommunity

𝗠𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 .𝗡𝗘𝗧 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟭: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗮𝗯𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗤𝘂𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗲𝘀• Use proper indexing to speed up queries.• Avoid N+1 queries in EF Core by using .Include() wisely.• Use bulk updates without loading data with ExecuteUpdateAsync() (EF Core 7+).𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟮: 𝗥𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗲 𝗧𝗶𝗺𝗲• Enable Response Caching to store frequent API results.• Use Gzip or Brotli compression to reduce payload size.• Return only necessary data using DTOs instead of full models.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟯: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗖𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘀• Implement asynchronous processing (async/await) to prevent blocking.• Use IAsyncEnumerable<T> for streaming large data efficiently.• Apply rate limiting to prevent API abuse with AspNetCore.RateLimit.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟰: 𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝗖𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗛𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰 𝗔𝗣𝗜𝘀• Use Redis or In-Memory Caching to reduce database hits.• Cache query results to avoid expensive DB operations.• Implement ETag headers for caching API responses.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟱: 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗹𝘆• Use load balancers to distribute traffic.• Move heavy processing to background jobs (Hangfire, Worker Services).• Implement API Gateways for better routing and security.𝗣𝗿𝗼 𝗧𝗶𝗽: 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗼𝗿 & 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗼𝘂𝘀𝗹𝘆Use Application Insights, Serilog, or OpenTelemetry to track performance and fix bottlenecks.hashtag#Dotnet hashtag#Performance hashtag#Csharp hashtag#Backend hashtag#Api hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SeniorDeveloperTips

Microservice Roadmap Creating a roadmap for implementing microservices architecture involves several key phases and considerations.Microservice RoadmapPhase 1: Assessment and Planning1.Understand Business Goals:✅️Identify the business objectives that the microservices architecture will support.✅️Engage stakeholders to gather requirements and expectations.2.Evaluate Current Architecture:✅️Assess the existing system architecture.✅️Identify pain points and limitations of the monolithic system.3.Define Success Metrics:✅️Establish KPIs to measure the success of the microservices implementation.4.Skill Assessment:✅️Evaluate the current team’s skills in microservices, DevOps, and cloud technologies.✅️Identify training needs or hiring requirements.Phase 2: Design and Strategy5.Define Service Boundaries:✅️Identify logical boundaries for microservices based on business capabilities.✅️Use domain-driven design (DDD) principles to guide service decomposition.6.Select Technology Stack:✅️Choose appropriate languages, frameworks, and tools for developing microservices.✅️Consider containerization (e.g., Docker), orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes), and cloud platforms.7.Design APIs:✅️Define API contracts (REST, gRPC, GraphQL) for communication between services.✅️Ensure APIs are versioned and follow best practices.8.Establish Data Management Strategy:✅️Decide on data ownership for each service.✅️Choose between shared databases and database per service patterns.Phase 3: Development and Implementation9.Set Up CI/CD Pipeline:✅️Implement continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines for automating builds and deployments.10.Develop Microservices:✅️Start building microservices iteratively, focusing on high-priority services first.✅️Follow best practices for coding, testing, and documentation.11.Implement Service Discovery:✅️Choose a service discovery mechanism (e.g., Eureka, Consul) to facilitate communication between services.12.Establish Monitoring and Logging:✅️Implement centralized logging (e.g., ELK Stack) and monitoring (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana) for observability.Phase 4: Testing and Quality Assurance13.Automated Testing:✅️Develop unit, integration, and contract tests for microservices.✅️Implement service virtualization for testing inter-service interactions.14.Load and Performance Testing:✅️Conduct load testing to ensure services can handle expected traffic.15.Security Assessment:✅️Implement security best practices, including API security (OAuth2, JWT) and service-to-service authentication.💡Ultimately, successful microservices implementation is not just about technology but also about aligning with business goals, fostering a collaborative culture, and continuously improving processes.Want to know more? ویدئو آموزشی به زبان فارسی و انگیسی را در کانال یوتوپ من دنبال کنید:https://lnkd.in/dcswikYbYou can also access the source code just here👇🔔🔔🔔https://lnkd.in/dCCgZ2JS🔆Sequential Execution🔆Pros:✅ Simple to understand✅ Practical execution order✅ Easy error handlingCons:❌ Slower overall execution❌ Waste potential parallel processing time❌ Each task must wait for previous completion🔆Parallel Execution🔆Pros:✅ Significantly faster overall execution✅ Tasks run concurrently✅ Better resource utilizationCons:❌ More complex error handling❌ Less control over execution order❌ Higher memory usage during concurrent execution💡When using Task.WhenAll, if any task throws an exception, it propagates to the await point. ### How to Easily Get a Remote Job Online The demand for remote jobs is skyrocketing! 🏡💻 If you want to earn well while working from home, following a few key strategies can help you succeed. ✅ **Develop the Right Skills** – Learn in-demand remote skills like graphic design, content writing, web development, digital marketing, or video editing. ✅ **Create a Professional Profile** – Build an attractive profile on platforms like LinkedIn, Upwork, Fiverr, and PeoplePerHour. Clearly highlight your experience and skills. ✅ **Network Effectively** – Networking is crucial for landing remote jobs. Stay active on LinkedIn, connect with industry experts, and share relevant posts. ✅ **Start with Small Projects** – Take on small projects initially, deliver quality work, and gradually increase your rates as you gain experience. ✅ **Maintain Professionalism** – Deliver work on time, build strong relationships with clients, and be open to feedback. 🎯 Start your remote job search today—your dream job might be waiting for you! 🚨 Job Offer or Scam? Beware of This Email Tactic!🚨 I recently received an email from Jennifer Brown offering me an internship or entry-level job opportunity. It seemed legitimate at first—they asked for my resume, reviewed it, and then rejected me. But what followed exposed the real motive behind this scheme!🔹 Jennifer emailed me again, saying, "Your resume was rejected due to a low ATS score, but I can connect you with someone who can improve it."🔹 When I agreed, she directed me to a Fiverr profile where I could "fix" my resume—for a price!🔹 This wasn’t the first time! A few weeks ago, I received a similar email from another person. I even reached out to their Fiverr contact, only to realize they were just selling paid resume reviews for $5–$10.This time, before I could fall for it again, I came across a LinkedIn post by Sarthak Mittal (CEO) exposing this scam (even the screenshot uploaded by Sarthak Mittal and the email I received have the same content written). That’s when it all clicked!⚠ Red Flags to Watch For:🚨 A rejection email followed by a paid service pitch.🚨 Being told your ATS score is too low and offered "help" for a fee.🚨 Recruiters redirecting you to Fiverr or paid platforms.🚨 Different names but the same tactics and email formats.💡 Lesson Learned? Never pay for job applications or resume fixes unless you’ve done your own research! There are plenty of free AI tools to improve your resume. Don’t let scammers profit off your job search struggles.Have you received similar emails? Let’s spread awareness and expose these scams together! Share your experiences in the comments. 🔍💬hashtag#EmailScam hashtag#JobScam hashtag#ScamAlert hashtag#CareerFraud hashtag#ResumeScam hashtag#ATSScam hashtag#StayAware hashtag#LinkedInCommunity

𝗠𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 .𝗡𝗘𝗧 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟭: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗮𝗯𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗤𝘂𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗲𝘀• Use proper indexing to speed up queries.• Avoid N+1 queries in EF Core by using .Include() wisely.• Use bulk updates without loading data with ExecuteUpdateAsync() (EF Core 7+).𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟮: 𝗥𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗲 𝗧𝗶𝗺𝗲• Enable Response Caching to store frequent API results.• Use Gzip or Brotli compression to reduce payload size.• Return only necessary data using DTOs instead of full models.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟯: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗖𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘀• Implement asynchronous processing (async/await) to prevent blocking.• Use IAsyncEnumerable<T> for streaming large data efficiently.• Apply rate limiting to prevent API abuse with AspNetCore.RateLimit.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟰: 𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝗖𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗛𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰 𝗔𝗣𝗜𝘀• Use Redis or In-Memory Caching to reduce database hits.• Cache query results to avoid expensive DB operations.• Implement ETag headers for caching API responses.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟱: 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗹𝘆• Use load balancers to distribute traffic.• Move heavy processing to background jobs (Hangfire, Worker Services).• Implement API Gateways for better routing and security.𝗣𝗿𝗼 𝗧𝗶𝗽: 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗼𝗿 & 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗼𝘂𝘀𝗹𝘆Use Application Insights, Serilog, or OpenTelemetry to track performance and fix bottlenecks.hashtag#Dotnet hashtag#Performance hashtag#Csharp hashtag#Backend hashtag#Api hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SeniorDeveloperTips

Microservice Roadmap Creating a roadmap for implementing microservices architecture involves several key phases and considerations.Microservice RoadmapPhase 1: Assessment and Planning1.Understand Business Goals:✅️Identify the business objectives that the microservices architecture will support.✅️Engage stakeholders to gather requirements and expectations.2.Evaluate Current Architecture:✅️Assess the existing system architecture.✅️Identify pain points and limitations of the monolithic system.3.Define Success Metrics:✅️Establish KPIs to measure the success of the microservices implementation.4.Skill Assessment:✅️Evaluate the current team’s skills in microservices, DevOps, and cloud technologies.✅️Identify training needs or hiring requirements.Phase 2: Design and Strategy5.Define Service Boundaries:✅️Identify logical boundaries for microservices based on business capabilities.✅️Use domain-driven design (DDD) principles to guide service decomposition.6.Select Technology Stack:✅️Choose appropriate languages, frameworks, and tools for developing microservices.✅️Consider containerization (e.g., Docker), orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes), and cloud platforms.7.Design APIs:✅️Define API contracts (REST, gRPC, GraphQL) for communication between services.✅️Ensure APIs are versioned and follow best practices.8.Establish Data Management Strategy:✅️Decide on data ownership for each service.✅️Choose between shared databases and database per service patterns.Phase 3: Development and Implementation9.Set Up CI/CD Pipeline:✅️Implement continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines for automating builds and deployments.10.Develop Microservices:✅️Start building microservices iteratively, focusing on high-priority services first.✅️Follow best practices for coding, testing, and documentation.11.Implement Service Discovery:✅️Choose a service discovery mechanism (e.g., Eureka, Consul) to facilitate communication between services.12.Establish Monitoring and Logging:✅️Implement centralized logging (e.g., ELK Stack) and monitoring (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana) for observability.Phase 4: Testing and Quality Assurance13.Automated Testing:✅️Develop unit, integration, and contract tests for microservices.✅️Implement service virtualization for testing inter-service interactions.14.Load and Performance Testing:✅️Conduct load testing to ensure services can handle expected traffic.15.Security Assessment:✅️Implement security best practices, including API security (OAuth2, JWT) and service-to-service authentication.💡Ultimately, successful microservices implementation is not just about technology but also about aligning with business goals, fostering a collaborative culture, and continuously improving processes.Want to know more? ویدئو آموزشی به زبان فارسی و انگیسی را در کانال یوتوپ من دنبال کنید:https://lnkd.in/dcswikYbYou can also access the source code just here👇🔔🔔🔔https://lnkd.in/dCCgZ2JS🔆Sequential Execution🔆Pros:✅ Simple to understand✅ Practical execution order✅ Easy error handlingCons:❌ Slower overall execution❌ Waste potential parallel processing time❌ Each task must wait for previous completion🔆Parallel Execution🔆Pros:✅ Significantly faster overall execution✅ Tasks run concurrently✅ Better resource utilizationCons:❌ More complex error handling❌ Less control over execution order❌ Higher memory usage during concurrent execution💡When using Task.WhenAll, if any task throws an exception, it propagates to the await point. This pattern allows you to handle exceptions from multiple tasks while maintaining proper async behavior.Asynchronous methods are better for I/O-bound operations, while simple methods are suitable for CPU-bound tasks.You can have the experience of developing this pattern here just on my 💎YouTube channel👇🔔🔔🔔https://lnkd.in/dMxGSjA5hashtaghashtag#programming hashtaghashtag#learntocode hashtaghashtag#csharpproject hashtaghashtag#dotnet hashtaghashtag#async hashtaghashtag#await hashtaghashtag#csharp hashtaghashtag#coding hashtaghashtag#cancellation hashtaghashtag#cancellations hashtaghashtag#cancellationtoken hashtaghashtag#token hashtaghashtag#tokens hashtaghashtag#github hashtaghashtag#dotnet hashtaghashtag#aspnetcore hashtaghashtag#cleancodehashtag#taskhashtag#awaithashtag#async

🚨 Job Offer or Scam? Beware of This Email Tactic!🚨 I recently received an email from Jennifer Brown offering me an internship or entry-level job opportunity. It seemed legitimate at first—they asked for my resume, reviewed it, and then rejected me. But what followed exposed the real motive behind this scheme!🔹 Jennifer emailed me again, saying, "Your resume was rejected due to a low ATS score, but I can connect you with someone who can improve it."🔹 When I agreed, she directed me to a Fiverr profile where I could "fix" my resume—for a price!🔹 This wasn’t the first time! A few weeks ago, I received a similar email from another person. I even reached out to their Fiverr contact, only to realize they were just selling paid resume reviews for $5–$10.This time, before I could fall for it again, I came across a LinkedIn post by Sarthak Mittal (CEO) exposing this scam (even the screenshot uploaded by Sarthak Mittal and the email I received have the same content written). That’s when it all clicked!⚠ Red Flags to Watch For:🚨 A rejection email followed by a paid service pitch.🚨 Being told your ATS score is too low and offered "help" for a fee.🚨 Recruiters redirecting you to Fiverr or paid platforms.🚨 Different names but the same tactics and email formats.💡 Lesson Learned? Never pay for job applications or resume fixes unless you’ve done your own research! There are plenty of free AI tools to improve your resume. Don’t let scammers profit off your job search struggles.Have you received similar emails? Let’s spread awareness and expose these scams together! Share your experiences in the comments. 🔍💬hashtag#EmailScam hashtag#JobScam hashtag#ScamAlert hashtag#CareerFraud hashtag#ResumeScam hashtag#ATSScam hashtag#StayAware hashtag#LinkedInCommunity

𝗠𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 .𝗡𝗘𝗧 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟭: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗮𝗯𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗤𝘂𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗲𝘀• Use proper indexing to speed up queries.• Avoid N+1 queries in EF Core by using .Include() wisely.• Use bulk updates without loading data with ExecuteUpdateAsync() (EF Core 7+).𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟮: 𝗥𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗲 𝗧𝗶𝗺𝗲• Enable Response Caching to store frequent API results.• Use Gzip or Brotli compression to reduce payload size.• Return only necessary data using DTOs instead of full models.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟯: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗖𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘀• Implement asynchronous processing (async/await) to prevent blocking.• Use IAsyncEnumerable<T> for streaming large data efficiently.• Apply rate limiting to prevent API abuse with AspNetCore.RateLimit.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟰: 𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝗖𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗛𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰 𝗔𝗣𝗜𝘀• Use Redis or In-Memory Caching to reduce database hits.• Cache query results to avoid expensive DB operations.• Implement ETag headers for caching API responses.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟱: 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗹𝘆• Use load balancers to distribute traffic.• Move heavy processing to background jobs (Hangfire, Worker Services).• Implement API Gateways for better routing and security.𝗣𝗿𝗼 𝗧𝗶𝗽: 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗼𝗿 & 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗼𝘂𝘀𝗹𝘆Use Application Insights, Serilog, or OpenTelemetry to track performance and fix bottlenecks.hashtag#Dotnet hashtag#Performance hashtag#Csharp hashtag#Backend hashtag#Api hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SeniorDeveloperTips

Microservice Roadmap Creating a roadmap for implementing microservices architecture involves several key phases and considerations.Microservice RoadmapPhase 1: Assessment and Planning1.Understand Business Goals:✅️Identify the business objectives that the microservices architecture will support.✅️Engage stakeholders to gather requirements and expectations.2.Evaluate Current Architecture:✅️Assess the existing system architecture.✅️Identify pain points and limitations of the monolithic system.3.Define Success Metrics:✅️Establish KPIs to measure the success of the microservices implementation.4.Skill Assessment:✅️Evaluate the current team’s skills in microservices, DevOps, and cloud technologies.✅️Identify training needs or hiring requirements.Phase 2: Design and Strategy5.Define Service Boundaries:✅️Identify logical boundaries for microservices based on business capabilities.✅️Use domain-driven design (DDD) principles to guide service decomposition.6.Select Technology Stack:✅️Choose appropriate languages, frameworks, and tools for developing microservices.✅️Consider containerization (e.g., Docker), orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes), and cloud platforms.7.Design APIs:✅️Define API contracts (REST, gRPC, GraphQL) for communication between services.✅️Ensure APIs are versioned and follow best practices.8.Establish Data Management Strategy:✅️Decide on data ownership for each service.✅️Choose between shared databases and database per service patterns.Phase 3: Development and Implementation9.Set Up CI/CD Pipeline:✅️Implement continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines for automating builds and deployments.10.Develop Microservices:✅️Start building microservices iteratively, focusing on high-priority services first.✅️Follow best practices for coding, testing, and documentation.11.Implement Service Discovery:✅️Choose a service discovery mechanism (e.g., Eureka, Consul) to facilitate communication between services.12.Establish Monitoring and Logging:✅️Implement centralized logging (e.g., ELK Stack) and monitoring (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana) for observability.Phase 4: Testing and Quality Assurance13.Automated Testing:✅️Develop unit, integration, and contract tests for microservices.✅️Implement service virtualization for testing inter-service interactions.14.Load and Performance Testing:✅️Conduct load testing to ensure services can handle expected traffic.15.Security Assessment:✅️Implement security best practices, including API security (OAuth2, JWT) and service-to-service authentication.💡Ultimately, successful microservices implementation is not just about technology but also about aligning with business goals, fostering a collaborative culture, and continuously improving processes.Want to know more? ویدئو آموزشی به زبان فارسی و انگیسی را در کانال یوتوپ من دنبال کنید:https://lnkd.in/dcswikYbYou can also access the source code just here👇🔔🔔🔔https://lnkd.in/dCCgZ2JS🔆Sequential Execution🔆Pros:✅ Simple to understand✅ Practical execution order✅ Easy error handlingCons:❌ Slower overall execution❌ Waste potential parallel processing time❌ Each task must wait for previous completion🔆Parallel Execution🔆Pros:✅ Significantly faster overall execution✅ Tasks run concurrently✅ Better resource utilizationCons:❌ More complex error handling❌ Less control over execution order❌ Higher memory usage during concurrent execution💡When using Task.WhenAll, if any task throws an exception, it propagates to the await point. ### How to Easily Get a Remote Job Online The demand for remote jobs is skyrocketing! 🏡💻 If you want to earn well while working from home, following a few key strategies can help you succeed. ✅ **Develop the Right Skills** – Learn in-demand remote skills like graphic design, content writing, web development, digital marketing, or video editing. ✅ **Create a Professional Profile** – Build an attractive profile on platforms like LinkedIn, Upwork, Fiverr, and PeoplePerHour. Clearly highlight your experience and skills. ✅ **Network Effectively** – Networking is crucial for landing remote jobs. Stay active on LinkedIn, connect with industry experts, and share relevant posts. ✅ **Start with Small Projects** – Take on small projects initially, deliver quality work, and gradually increase your rates as you gain experience. ✅ **Maintain Professionalism** – Deliver work on time, build strong relationships with clients, and be open to feedback. 🎯 Start your remote job search today—your dream job might be waiting for you! 🚨 Job Offer or Scam? Beware of This Email Tactic!🚨 I recently received an email from Jennifer Brown offering me an internship or entry-level job opportunity. It seemed legitimate at first—they asked for my resume, reviewed it, and then rejected me. But what followed exposed the real motive behind this scheme!🔹 Jennifer emailed me again, saying, "Your resume was rejected due to a low ATS score, but I can connect you with someone who can improve it."🔹 When I agreed, she directed me to a Fiverr profile where I could "fix" my resume—for a price!🔹 This wasn’t the first time! A few weeks ago, I received a similar email from another person. I even reached out to their Fiverr contact, only to realize they were just selling paid resume reviews for $5–$10.This time, before I could fall for it again, I came across a LinkedIn post by Sarthak Mittal (CEO) exposing this scam (even the screenshot uploaded by Sarthak Mittal and the email I received have the same content written). That’s when it all clicked!⚠ Red Flags to Watch For:🚨 A rejection email followed by a paid service pitch.🚨 Being told your ATS score is too low and offered "help" for a fee.🚨 Recruiters redirecting you to Fiverr or paid platforms.🚨 Different names but the same tactics and email formats.💡 Lesson Learned? Never pay for job applications or resume fixes unless you’ve done your own research! There are plenty of free AI tools to improve your resume. Don’t let scammers profit off your job search struggles.Have you received similar emails? Let’s spread awareness and expose these scams together! Share your experiences in the comments. 🔍💬hashtag#EmailScam hashtag#JobScam hashtag#ScamAlert hashtag#CareerFraud hashtag#ResumeScam hashtag#ATSScam hashtag#StayAware hashtag#LinkedInCommunity

𝗠𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 .𝗡𝗘𝗧 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟭: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗮𝗯𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗤𝘂𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗲𝘀• Use proper indexing to speed up queries.• Avoid N+1 queries in EF Core by using .Include() wisely.• Use bulk updates without loading data with ExecuteUpdateAsync() (EF Core 7+).𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟮: 𝗥𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗲 𝗧𝗶𝗺𝗲• Enable Response Caching to store frequent API results.• Use Gzip or Brotli compression to reduce payload size.• Return only necessary data using DTOs instead of full models.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟯: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗖𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘀• Implement asynchronous processing (async/await) to prevent blocking.• Use IAsyncEnumerable<T> for streaming large data efficiently.• Apply rate limiting to prevent API abuse with AspNetCore.RateLimit.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟰: 𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝗖𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗛𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰 𝗔𝗣𝗜𝘀• Use Redis or In-Memory Caching to reduce database hits.• Cache query results to avoid expensive DB operations.• Implement ETag headers for caching API responses.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟱: 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗹𝘆• Use load balancers to distribute traffic.• Move heavy processing to background jobs (Hangfire, Worker Services).• Implement API Gateways for better routing and security.𝗣𝗿𝗼 𝗧𝗶𝗽: 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗼𝗿 & 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗼𝘂𝘀𝗹𝘆Use Application Insights, Serilog, or OpenTelemetry to track performance and fix bottlenecks.hashtag#Dotnet hashtag#Performance hashtag#Csharp hashtag#Backend hashtag#Api hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SeniorDeveloperTips

Microservice Roadmap Creating a roadmap for implementing microservices architecture involves several key phases and considerations.Microservice RoadmapPhase 1: Assessment and Planning1.Understand Business Goals:✅️Identify the business objectives that the microservices architecture will support.✅️Engage stakeholders to gather requirements and expectations.2.Evaluate Current Architecture:✅️Assess the existing system architecture.✅️Identify pain points and limitations of the monolithic system.3.Define Success Metrics:✅️Establish KPIs to measure the success of the microservices implementation.4.Skill Assessment:✅️Evaluate the current team’s skills in microservices, DevOps, and cloud technologies.✅️Identify training needs or hiring requirements.Phase 2: Design and Strategy5.Define Service Boundaries:✅️Identify logical boundaries for microservices based on business capabilities.✅️Use domain-driven design (DDD) principles to guide service decomposition.6.Select Technology Stack:✅️Choose appropriate languages, frameworks, and tools for developing microservices.✅️Consider containerization (e.g., Docker), orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes), and cloud platforms.7.Design APIs:✅️Define API contracts (REST, gRPC, GraphQL) for communication between services.✅️Ensure APIs are versioned and follow best practices.8.Establish Data Management Strategy:✅️Decide on data ownership for each service.✅️Choose between shared databases and database per service patterns.Phase 3: Development and Implementation9.Set Up CI/CD Pipeline:✅️Implement continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines for automating builds and deployments.10.Develop Microservices:✅️Start building microservices iteratively, focusing on high-priority services first.✅️Follow best practices for coding, testing, and documentation.11.Implement Service Discovery:✅️Choose a service discovery mechanism (e.g., Eureka, Consul) to facilitate communication between services.12.Establish Monitoring and Logging:✅️Implement centralized logging (e.g., ELK Stack) and monitoring (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana) for observability.Phase 4: Testing and Quality Assurance13.Automated Testing:✅️Develop unit, integration, and contract tests for microservices.✅️Implement service virtualization for testing inter-service interactions.14.Load and Performance Testing:✅️Conduct load testing to ensure services can handle expected traffic.15.Security Assessment:✅️Implement security best practices, including API security (OAuth2, JWT) and service-to-service authentication.💡Ultimately, successful microservices implementation is not just about technology but also about aligning with business goals, fostering a collaborative culture, and continuously improving processes.Want to know more? ویدئو آموزشی به زبان فارسی و انگیسی را در کانال یوتوپ من دنبال کنید:https://lnkd.in/dcswikYbYou can also access the source code just here👇🔔🔔🔔https://lnkd.in/dCCgZ2JS🔆Sequential Execution🔆Pros:✅ Simple to understand✅ Practical execution order✅ Easy error handlingCons:❌ Slower overall execution❌ Waste potential parallel processing time❌ Each task must wait for previous completion🔆Parallel Execution🔆Pros:✅ Significantly faster overall execution✅ Tasks run concurrently✅ Better resource utilizationCons:❌ More complex error handling❌ Less control over execution order❌ Higher memory usage during concurrent execution💡When using Task.WhenAll, if any task throws an exception, it propagates to the await point. ### How to Easily Get a Remote Job Online The demand for remote jobs is skyrocketing! 🏡💻 If you want to earn well while working from home, following a few key strategies can help you succeed. ✅ **Develop the Right Skills** – Learn in-demand remote skills like graphic design, content writing, web development, digital marketing, or video editing. ✅ **Create a Professional Profile** – Build an attractive profile on platforms like LinkedIn, Upwork, Fiverr, and PeoplePerHour. Clearly highlight your experience and skills. ✅ **Network Effectively** – Networking is crucial for landing remote jobs. Stay active on LinkedIn, connect with industry experts, and share relevant posts. ✅ **Start with Small Projects** – Take on small projects initially, deliver quality work, and gradually increase your rates as you gain experience. ✅ **Maintain Professionalism** – Deliver work on time, build strong relationships with clients, and be open to feedback. 🎯 Start your remote job search today—your dream job might be waiting for you! 🚨 Job Offer or Scam? Beware of This Email Tactic!🚨 I recently received an email from Jennifer Brown offering me an internship or entry-level job opportunity. It seemed legitimate at first—they asked for my resume, reviewed it, and then rejected me. But what followed exposed the real motive behind this scheme!🔹 Jennifer emailed me again, saying, "Your resume was rejected due to a low ATS score, but I can connect you with someone who can improve it."🔹 When I agreed, she directed me to a Fiverr profile where I could "fix" my resume—for a price!🔹 This wasn’t the first time! A few weeks ago, I received a similar email from another person. I even reached out to their Fiverr contact, only to realize they were just selling paid resume reviews for $5–$10.This time, before I could fall for it again, I came across a LinkedIn post by Sarthak Mittal (CEO) exposing this scam (even the screenshot uploaded by Sarthak Mittal and the email I received have the same content written). That’s when it all clicked!⚠ Red Flags to Watch For:🚨 A rejection email followed by a paid service pitch.🚨 Being told your ATS score is too low and offered "help" for a fee.🚨 Recruiters redirecting you to Fiverr or paid platforms.🚨 Different names but the same tactics and email formats.💡 Lesson Learned? Never pay for job applications or resume fixes unless you’ve done your own research! There are plenty of free AI tools to improve your resume. Don’t let scammers profit off your job search struggles.Have you received similar emails? Let’s spread awareness and expose these scams together! Share your experiences in the comments. 🔍💬hashtag#EmailScam hashtag#JobScam hashtag#ScamAlert hashtag#CareerFraud hashtag#ResumeScam hashtag#ATSScam hashtag#StayAware hashtag#LinkedInCommunity

𝗠𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 .𝗡𝗘𝗧 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟭: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗮𝗯𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗤𝘂𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗲𝘀• Use proper indexing to speed up queries.• Avoid N+1 queries in EF Core by using .Include() wisely.• Use bulk updates without loading data with ExecuteUpdateAsync() (EF Core 7+).𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟮: 𝗥𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗲 𝗧𝗶𝗺𝗲• Enable Response Caching to store frequent API results.• Use Gzip or Brotli compression to reduce payload size.• Return only necessary data using DTOs instead of full models.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟯: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗖𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘀• Implement asynchronous processing (async/await) to prevent blocking.• Use IAsyncEnumerable<T> for streaming large data efficiently.• Apply rate limiting to prevent API abuse with AspNetCore.RateLimit.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟰: 𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝗖𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗛𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰 𝗔𝗣𝗜𝘀• Use Redis or In-Memory Caching to reduce database hits.• Cache query results to avoid expensive DB operations.• Implement ETag headers for caching API responses.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟱: 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗹𝘆• Use load balancers to distribute traffic.• Move heavy processing to background jobs (Hangfire, Worker Services).• Implement API Gateways for better routing and security.𝗣𝗿𝗼 𝗧𝗶𝗽: 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗼𝗿 & 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗼𝘂𝘀𝗹𝘆Use Application Insights, Serilog, or OpenTelemetry to track performance and fix bottlenecks.hashtag#Dotnet hashtag#Performance hashtag#Csharp hashtag#Backend hashtag#Api hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SeniorDeveloperTips

Microservice Roadmap Creating a roadmap for implementing microservices architecture involves several key phases and considerations.Microservice RoadmapPhase 1: Assessment and Planning1.Understand Business Goals:✅️Identify the business objectives that the microservices architecture will support.✅️Engage stakeholders to gather requirements and expectations.2.Evaluate Current Architecture:✅️Assess the existing system architecture.✅️Identify pain points and limitations of the monolithic system.3.Define Success Metrics:✅️Establish KPIs to measure the success of the microservices implementation.4.Skill Assessment:✅️Evaluate the current team’s skills in microservices, DevOps, and cloud technologies.✅️Identify training needs or hiring requirements.Phase 2: Design and Strategy5.Define Service Boundaries:✅️Identify logical boundaries for microservices based on business capabilities.✅️Use domain-driven design (DDD) principles to guide service decomposition.6.Select Technology Stack:✅️Choose appropriate languages, frameworks, and tools for developing microservices.✅️Consider containerization (e.g., Docker), orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes), and cloud platforms.7.Design APIs:✅️Define API contracts (REST, gRPC, GraphQL) for communication between services.✅️Ensure APIs are versioned and follow best practices.8.Establish Data Management Strategy:✅️Decide on data ownership for each service.✅️Choose between shared databases and database per service patterns.Phase 3: Development and Implementation9.Set Up CI/CD Pipeline:✅️Implement continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines for automating builds and deployments.10.Develop Microservices:✅️Start building microservices iteratively, focusing on high-priority services first.✅️Follow best practices for coding, testing, and documentation.11.Implement Service Discovery:✅️Choose a service discovery mechanism (e.g., Eureka, Consul) to facilitate communication between services.12.Establish Monitoring and Logging:✅️Implement centralized logging (e.g., ELK Stack) and monitoring (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana) for observability.Phase 4: Testing and Quality Assurance13.Automated Testing:✅️Develop unit, integration, and contract tests for microservices.✅️Implement service virtualization for testing inter-service interactions.14.Load and Performance Testing:✅️Conduct load testing to ensure services can handle expected traffic.15.Security Assessment:✅️Implement security best practices, including API security (OAuth2, JWT) and service-to-service authentication.💡Ultimately, successful microservices implementation is not just about technology but also about aligning with business goals, fostering a collaborative culture, and continuously improving processes.Want to know more? ویدئو آموزشی به زبان فارسی و انگیسی را در کانال یوتوپ من دنبال کنید:https://lnkd.in/dcswikYbYou can also access the source code just here👇🔔🔔🔔https://lnkd.in/dCCgZ2JS🔆Sequential Execution🔆Pros:✅ Simple to understand✅ Practical execution order✅ Easy error handlingCons:❌ Slower overall execution❌ Waste potential parallel processing time❌ Each task must wait for previous completion🔆Parallel Execution🔆Pros:✅ Significantly faster overall execution✅ Tasks run concurrently✅ Better resource utilizationCons:❌ More complex error handling❌ Less control over execution order❌ Higher memory usage during concurrent execution💡When using Task.WhenAll, if any task throws an exception, it propagates to the await point. This pattern allows you to handle exceptions from multiple tasks while maintaining proper async behavior.Asynchronous methods are better for I/O-bound operations, while simple methods are suitable for CPU-bound tasks.You can have the experience of developing this pattern here just on my 💎YouTube channel👇🔔🔔🔔https://lnkd.in/dMxGSjA5hashtaghashtag#programming hashtaghashtag#learntocode hashtaghashtag#csharpproject hashtaghashtag#dotnet hashtaghashtag#async hashtaghashtag#await hashtaghashtag#csharp hashtaghashtag#coding hashtaghashtag#cancellation hashtaghashtag#cancellations hashtaghashtag#cancellationtoken hashtaghashtag#token hashtaghashtag#tokens hashtaghashtag#github hashtaghashtag#dotnet hashtaghashtag#aspnetcore hashtaghashtag#cleancodehashtag#taskhashtag#awaithashtag#async

Y, si no, que se vean esas ofertas. Que me hincho a rellenar mi perfil 4 mil veces en estos lugares web y luego no recibo ni una sola propuesta y, lo que es peor, ni una en condiciones ofrecida en ninguno de estos portales, por favor! Muchos incluso están vacíos, igual se busca robar nuestros datos para venderlos. Que yo aquí he aplicado a Volkswagen, Seur, Amazon, Loewe, es decir, a empresas reales, donde he estado pasando proceso de selección. ¿Cómo podéis decir que se pierde el tiempo cuando son procesos de verdad? ### How to Easily Get a Remote Job Online The demand for remote jobs is skyrocketing! 🏡💻 If you want to earn well while working from home, following a few key strategies can help you succeed. ✅ **Develop the Right Skills** – Learn in-demand remote skills like graphic design, content writing, web development, digital marketing, or video editing. ✅ **Create a Professional Profile** – Build an attractive profile on platforms like LinkedIn, Upwork, Fiverr, and PeoplePerHour. Clearly highlight your experience and skills. ✅ **Network Effectively** – Networking is crucial for landing remote jobs. Stay active on LinkedIn, connect with industry experts, and share relevant posts. ✅ **Start with Small Projects** – Take on small projects initially, deliver quality work, and gradually increase your rates as you gain experience. ✅ **Maintain Professionalism** – Deliver work on time, build strong relationships with clients, and be open to feedback. 🎯 Start your remote job search today—your dream job might be waiting for you! 🚨 Job Offer or Scam? Beware of This Email Tactic!🚨 I recently received an email from Jennifer Brown offering me an internship or entry-level job opportunity. It seemed legitimate at first—they asked for my resume, reviewed it, and then rejected me. But what followed exposed the real motive behind this scheme!🔹 Jennifer emailed me again, saying, "Your resume was rejected due to a low ATS score, but I can connect you with someone who can improve it."🔹 When I agreed, she directed me to a Fiverr profile where I could "fix" my resume—for a price!🔹 This wasn’t the first time! A few weeks ago, I received a similar email from another person. I even reached out to their Fiverr contact, only to realize they were just selling paid resume reviews for $5–$10.This time, before I could fall for it again, I came across a LinkedIn post by Sarthak Mittal (CEO) exposing this scam (even the screenshot uploaded by Sarthak Mittal and the email I received have the same content written). That’s when it all clicked!⚠ Red Flags to Watch For:🚨 A rejection email followed by a paid service pitch.🚨 Being told your ATS score is too low and offered "help" for a fee.🚨 Recruiters redirecting you to Fiverr or paid platforms.🚨 Different names but the same tactics and email formats.💡 Lesson Learned? Never pay for job applications or resume fixes unless you’ve done your own research! There are plenty of free AI tools to improve your resume. Don’t let scammers profit off your job search struggles.Have you received similar emails? Let’s spread awareness and expose these scams together! Share your experiences in the comments. 🔍💬hashtag#EmailScam hashtag#JobScam hashtag#ScamAlert hashtag#CareerFraud hashtag#ResumeScam hashtag#ATSScam hashtag#StayAware hashtag#LinkedInCommunity

𝗠𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 .𝗡𝗘𝗧 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟭: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗮𝗯𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗤𝘂𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗲𝘀• Use proper indexing to speed up queries.• Avoid N+1 queries in EF Core by using .Include() wisely.• Use bulk updates without loading data with ExecuteUpdateAsync() (EF Core 7+).𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟮: 𝗥𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗲 𝗧𝗶𝗺𝗲• Enable Response Caching to store frequent API results.• Use Gzip or Brotli compression to reduce payload size.• Return only necessary data using DTOs instead of full models.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟯: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗖𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘀• Implement asynchronous processing (async/await) to prevent blocking.• Use IAsyncEnumerable<T> for streaming large data efficiently.• Apply rate limiting to prevent API abuse with AspNetCore.RateLimit.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟰: 𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝗖𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗛𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰 𝗔𝗣𝗜𝘀• Use Redis or In-Memory Caching to reduce database hits.• Cache query results to avoid expensive DB operations.• Implement ETag headers for caching API responses.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟱: 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗹𝘆• Use load balancers to distribute traffic.• Move heavy processing to background jobs (Hangfire, Worker Services).• Implement API Gateways for better routing and security.𝗣𝗿𝗼 𝗧𝗶𝗽: 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗼𝗿 & 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗼𝘂𝘀𝗹𝘆Use Application Insights, Serilog, or OpenTelemetry to track performance and fix bottlenecks.hashtag#Dotnet hashtag#Performance hashtag#Csharp hashtag#Backend hashtag#Api hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SeniorDeveloperTips

Microservice Roadmap Creating a roadmap for implementing microservices architecture involves several key phases and considerations.Microservice RoadmapPhase 1: Assessment and Planning1.Understand Business Goals:✅️Identify the business objectives that the microservices architecture will support.✅️Engage stakeholders to gather requirements and expectations.2.Evaluate Current Architecture:✅️Assess the existing system architecture.✅️Identify pain points and limitations of the monolithic system.3.Define Success Metrics:✅️Establish KPIs to measure the success of the microservices implementation.4.Skill Assessment:✅️Evaluate the current team’s skills in microservices, DevOps, and cloud technologies.✅️Identify training needs or hiring requirements.Phase 2: Design and Strategy5.Define Service Boundaries:✅️Identify logical boundaries for microservices based on business capabilities.✅️Use domain-driven design (DDD) principles to guide service decomposition.6.Select Technology Stack:✅️Choose appropriate languages, frameworks, and tools for developing microservices.✅️Consider containerization (e.g., Docker), orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes), and cloud platforms.7.Design APIs:✅️Define API contracts (REST, gRPC, GraphQL) for communication between services.✅️Ensure APIs are versioned and follow best practices.8.Establish Data Management Strategy:✅️Decide on data ownership for each service.✅️Choose between shared databases and database per service patterns.Phase 3: Development and Implementation9.Set Up CI/CD Pipeline:✅️Implement continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines for automating builds and deployments.10.Develop Microservices:✅️Start building microservices iteratively, focusing on high-priority services first.✅️Follow best practices for coding, testing, and documentation.11.Implement Service Discovery:✅️Choose a service discovery mechanism (e.g., Eureka, Consul) to facilitate communication between services.12.Establish Monitoring and Logging:✅️Implement centralized logging (e.g., ELK Stack) and monitoring (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana) for observability.Phase 4: Testing and Quality Assurance13.Automated Testing:✅️Develop unit, integration, and contract tests for microservices.✅️Implement service virtualization for testing inter-service interactions.14.Load and Performance Testing:✅️Conduct load testing to ensure services can handle expected traffic.15.Security Assessment:✅️Implement security best practices, including API security (OAuth2, JWT) and service-to-service authentication.💡Ultimately, successful microservices implementation is not just about technology but also about aligning with business goals, fostering a collaborative culture, and continuously improving processes.Want to know more? Securing the Future of the UK Food Industry: The Strategic Role of ApprenticeshipsWith the UK food and beverage sector employing over half a million people and contributing £38 billion to the economy annually, the industry’s success depends on a skilled, future-ready workforce. Yet, a national shortage of food scientists and technologists threatens long-term sustainability.Apprenticeships are emerging as a powerful solution—bridging the skills gap, fostering innovation, and providing businesses with a pipeline of specialized talent. Companies like Fera Science and Tesco are investing in structured training programs that equip the next generation with hands-on experience and industry-specific expertise. However, systemic change is needed. The proposed Growth and Skills Levy could play a pivotal role in reforming workforce development, ensuring apprenticeships remain a strategic asset for the sector.How can businesses and policymakers collaborate to enhance the impact of apprenticeships? ویدئو آموزشی به زبان فارسی و انگیسی را در کانال یوتوپ من دنبال کنید:https://lnkd.in/dcswikYbYou can also access the source code just here👇🔔🔔🔔https://lnkd.in/dCCgZ2JS🔆Sequential Execution🔆Pros:✅ Simple to understand✅ Practical execution order✅ Easy error handlingCons:❌ Slower overall execution❌ Waste potential parallel processing time❌ Each task must wait for previous completion🔆Parallel Execution🔆Pros:✅ Significantly faster overall execution✅ Tasks run concurrently✅ Better resource utilizationCons:❌ More complex error handling❌ Less control over execution order❌ Higher memory usage during concurrent execution💡When using Task.WhenAll, if any task throws an exception, it propagates to the await point. This pattern allows you to handle exceptions from multiple tasks while maintaining proper async behavior.Asynchronous methods are better for I/O-bound operations, while simple methods are suitable for CPU-bound tasks.You can have the experience of developing this pattern here just on my 💎YouTube channel👇🔔🔔🔔https://lnkd.in/dMxGSjA5hashtaghashtag#programming hashtaghashtag#learntocode hashtaghashtag#csharpproject hashtaghashtag#dotnet hashtaghashtag#async hashtaghashtag#await hashtaghashtag#csharp hashtaghashtag#coding hashtaghashtag#cancellation hashtaghashtag#cancellations hashtaghashtag#cancellationtoken hashtaghashtag#token hashtaghashtag#tokens hashtaghashtag#github hashtaghashtag#dotnet hashtaghashtag#aspnetcore hashtaghashtag#cleancodehashtag#taskhashtag#awaithashtag#async

Y, si no, que se vean esas ofertas. Que me hincho a rellenar mi perfil 4 mil veces en estos lugares web y luego no recibo ni una sola propuesta y, lo que es peor, ni una en condiciones ofrecida en ninguno de estos portales, por favor! Muchos incluso están vacíos, igual se busca robar nuestros datos para venderlos. Que yo aquí he aplicado a Volkswagen, Seur, Amazon, Loewe, es decir, a empresas reales, donde he estado pasando proceso de selección. ¿Cómo podéis decir que se pierde el tiempo cuando son procesos de verdad? Me parece de una carencia de ética absoluta, ojalá se os penalizara por eso. Y encima eso de "sin necesidad de hablar inglés". Jajaja, es alucinante...

### How to Easily Get a Remote Job Online The demand for remote jobs is skyrocketing! 🏡💻 If you want to earn well while working from home, following a few key strategies can help you succeed. ✅ **Develop the Right Skills** – Learn in-demand remote skills like graphic design, content writing, web development, digital marketing, or video editing. ✅ **Create a Professional Profile** – Build an attractive profile on platforms like LinkedIn, Upwork, Fiverr, and PeoplePerHour. Clearly highlight your experience and skills. ✅ **Network Effectively** – Networking is crucial for landing remote jobs. Stay active on LinkedIn, connect with industry experts, and share relevant posts. ✅ **Start with Small Projects** – Take on small projects initially, deliver quality work, and gradually increase your rates as you gain experience. ✅ **Maintain Professionalism** – Deliver work on time, build strong relationships with clients, and be open to feedback. 🎯 Start your remote job search today—your dream job might be waiting for you! 🚨 Job Offer or Scam? Beware of This Email Tactic!🚨 I recently received an email from Jennifer Brown offering me an internship or entry-level job opportunity. It seemed legitimate at first—they asked for my resume, reviewed it, and then rejected me. But what followed exposed the real motive behind this scheme!🔹 Jennifer emailed me again, saying, "Your resume was rejected due to a low ATS score, but I can connect you with someone who can improve it."🔹 When I agreed, she directed me to a Fiverr profile where I could "fix" my resume—for a price!🔹 This wasn’t the first time! A few weeks ago, I received a similar email from another person. I even reached out to their Fiverr contact, only to realize they were just selling paid resume reviews for $5–$10.This time, before I could fall for it again, I came across a LinkedIn post by Sarthak Mittal (CEO) exposing this scam (even the screenshot uploaded by Sarthak Mittal and the email I received have the same content written). That’s when it all clicked!⚠ Red Flags to Watch For:🚨 A rejection email followed by a paid service pitch.🚨 Being told your ATS score is too low and offered "help" for a fee.🚨 Recruiters redirecting you to Fiverr or paid platforms.🚨 Different names but the same tactics and email formats.💡 Lesson Learned? Never pay for job applications or resume fixes unless you’ve done your own research! There are plenty of free AI tools to improve your resume. Don’t let scammers profit off your job search struggles.Have you received similar emails? Let’s spread awareness and expose these scams together! Share your experiences in the comments. 🔍💬hashtag#EmailScam hashtag#JobScam hashtag#ScamAlert hashtag#CareerFraud hashtag#ResumeScam hashtag#ATSScam hashtag#StayAware hashtag#LinkedInCommunity

𝗠𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 .𝗡𝗘𝗧 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟭: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗮𝗯𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗤𝘂𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗲𝘀• Use proper indexing to speed up queries.• Avoid N+1 queries in EF Core by using .Include() wisely.• Use bulk updates without loading data with ExecuteUpdateAsync() (EF Core 7+).𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟮: 𝗥𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗲 𝗧𝗶𝗺𝗲• Enable Response Caching to store frequent API results.• Use Gzip or Brotli compression to reduce payload size.• Return only necessary data using DTOs instead of full models.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟯: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗖𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘀• Implement asynchronous processing (async/await) to prevent blocking.• Use IAsyncEnumerable<T> for streaming large data efficiently.• Apply rate limiting to prevent API abuse with AspNetCore.RateLimit.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟰: 𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝗖𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗛𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰 𝗔𝗣𝗜𝘀• Use Redis or In-Memory Caching to reduce database hits.• Cache query results to avoid expensive DB operations.• Implement ETag headers for caching API responses.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟱: 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗹𝘆• Use load balancers to distribute traffic.• Move heavy processing to background jobs (Hangfire, Worker Services).• Implement API Gateways for better routing and security.𝗣𝗿𝗼 𝗧𝗶𝗽: 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗼𝗿 & 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗼𝘂𝘀𝗹𝘆Use Application Insights, Serilog, or OpenTelemetry to track performance and fix bottlenecks.hashtag#Dotnet hashtag#Performance hashtag#Csharp hashtag#Backend hashtag#Api hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SeniorDeveloperTips

Microservice Roadmap Creating a roadmap for implementing microservices architecture involves several key phases and considerations.Microservice RoadmapPhase 1: Assessment and Planning1.Understand Business Goals:✅️Identify the business objectives that the microservices architecture will support.✅️Engage stakeholders to gather requirements and expectations.2.Evaluate Current Architecture:✅️Assess the existing system architecture.✅️Identify pain points and limitations of the monolithic system.3.Define Success Metrics:✅️Establish KPIs to measure the success of the microservices implementation.4.Skill Assessment:✅️Evaluate the current team’s skills in microservices, DevOps, and cloud technologies.✅️Identify training needs or hiring requirements.Phase 2: Design and Strategy5.Define Service Boundaries:✅️Identify logical boundaries for microservices based on business capabilities.✅️Use domain-driven design (DDD) principles to guide service decomposition.6.Select Technology Stack:✅️Choose appropriate languages, frameworks, and tools for developing microservices.✅️Consider containerization (e.g., Docker), orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes), and cloud platforms.7.Design APIs:✅️Define API contracts (REST, gRPC, GraphQL) for communication between services.✅️Ensure APIs are versioned and follow best practices.8.Establish Data Management Strategy:✅️Decide on data ownership for each service.✅️Choose between shared databases and database per service patterns.Phase 3: Development and Implementation9.Set Up CI/CD Pipeline:✅️Implement continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines for automating builds and deployments.10.Develop Microservices:✅️Start building microservices iteratively, focusing on high-priority services first.✅️Follow best practices for coding, testing, and documentation.11.Implement Service Discovery:✅️Choose a service discovery mechanism (e.g., Eureka, Consul) to facilitate communication between services.12.Establish Monitoring and Logging:✅️Implement centralized logging (e.g., ELK Stack) and monitoring (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana) for observability.Phase 4: Testing and Quality Assurance13.Automated Testing:✅️Develop unit, integration, and contract tests for microservices.✅️Implement service virtualization for testing inter-service interactions.14.Load and Performance Testing:✅️Conduct load testing to ensure services can handle expected traffic.15.Security Assessment:✅️Implement security best practices, including API security (OAuth2, JWT) and service-to-service authentication.💡Ultimately, successful microservices implementation is not just about technology but also about aligning with business goals, fostering a collaborative culture, and continuously improving processes.Want to know more? Securing the Future of the UK Food Industry: The Strategic Role of ApprenticeshipsWith the UK food and beverage sector employing over half a million people and contributing £38 billion to the economy annually, the industry’s success depends on a skilled, future-ready workforce. Yet, a national shortage of food scientists and technologists threatens long-term sustainability.Apprenticeships are emerging as a powerful solution—bridging the skills gap, fostering innovation, and providing businesses with a pipeline of specialized talent. Companies like Fera Science and Tesco are investing in structured training programs that equip the next generation with hands-on experience and industry-specific expertise. However, systemic change is needed. The proposed Growth and Skills Levy could play a pivotal role in reforming workforce development, ensuring apprenticeships remain a strategic asset for the sector.How can businesses and policymakers collaborate to enhance the impact of apprenticeships? ویدئو آموزشی به زبان فارسی و انگیسی را در کانال یوتوپ من دنبال کنید:https://lnkd.in/dcswikYbYou can also access the source code just here👇🔔🔔🔔https://lnkd.in/dCCgZ2JS🔆Sequential Execution🔆Pros:✅ Simple to understand✅ Practical execution order✅ Easy error handlingCons:❌ Slower overall execution❌ Waste potential parallel processing time❌ Each task must wait for previous completion🔆Parallel Execution🔆Pros:✅ Significantly faster overall execution✅ Tasks run concurrently✅ Better resource utilizationCons:❌ More complex error handling❌ Less control over execution order❌ Higher memory usage during concurrent execution💡When using Task.WhenAll, if any task throws an exception, it propagates to the await point. This pattern allows you to handle exceptions from multiple tasks while maintaining proper async behavior.Asynchronous methods are better for I/O-bound operations, while simple methods are suitable for CPU-bound tasks.You can have the experience of developing this pattern here just on my 💎YouTube channel👇🔔🔔🔔https://lnkd.in/dMxGSjA5hashtaghashtag#programming hashtaghashtag#learntocode hashtaghashtag#csharpproject hashtaghashtag#dotnet hashtaghashtag#async hashtaghashtag#await hashtaghashtag#csharp hashtaghashtag#coding hashtaghashtag#cancellation hashtaghashtag#cancellations hashtaghashtag#cancellationtoken hashtaghashtag#token hashtaghashtag#tokens hashtaghashtag#github hashtaghashtag#dotnet hashtaghashtag#aspnetcore hashtaghashtag#cleancodehashtag#taskhashtag#awaithashtag#async

Y, si no, que se vean esas ofertas. Que me hincho a rellenar mi perfil 4 mil veces en estos lugares web y luego no recibo ni una sola propuesta y, lo que es peor, ni una en condiciones ofrecida en ninguno de estos portales, por favor! Muchos incluso están vacíos, igual se busca robar nuestros datos para venderlos. Que yo aquí he aplicado a Volkswagen, Seur, Amazon, Loewe, es decir, a empresas reales, donde he estado pasando proceso de selección. ¿Cómo podéis decir que se pierde el tiempo cuando son procesos de verdad? Me parece de una carencia de ética absoluta, ojalá se os penalizara por eso. Y encima eso de "sin necesidad de hablar inglés". Jajaja, es alucinante...

### How to Easily Get a Remote Job Online The demand for remote jobs is skyrocketing! 🏡💻 If you want to earn well while working from home, following a few key strategies can help you succeed. ✅ **Develop the Right Skills** – Learn in-demand remote skills like graphic design, content writing, web development, digital marketing, or video editing. ✅ **Create a Professional Profile** – Build an attractive profile on platforms like LinkedIn, Upwork, Fiverr, and PeoplePerHour. Clearly highlight your experience and skills. ✅ **Network Effectively** – Networking is crucial for landing remote jobs. Stay active on LinkedIn, connect with industry experts, and share relevant posts. ✅ **Start with Small Projects** – Take on small projects initially, deliver quality work, and gradually increase your rates as you gain experience. ✅ **Maintain Professionalism** – Deliver work on time, build strong relationships with clients, and be open to feedback. 🎯 Start your remote job search today—your dream job might be waiting for you! 🚨 Job Offer or Scam? Beware of This Email Tactic!🚨 I recently received an email from Jennifer Brown offering me an internship or entry-level job opportunity. It seemed legitimate at first—they asked for my resume, reviewed it, and then rejected me. But what followed exposed the real motive behind this scheme!🔹 Jennifer emailed me again, saying, "Your resume was rejected due to a low ATS score, but I can connect you with someone who can improve it."🔹 When I agreed, she directed me to a Fiverr profile where I could "fix" my resume—for a price!🔹 This wasn’t the first time! A few weeks ago, I received a similar email from another person. I even reached out to their Fiverr contact, only to realize they were just selling paid resume reviews for $5–$10.This time, before I could fall for it again, I came across a LinkedIn post by Sarthak Mittal (CEO) exposing this scam (even the screenshot uploaded by Sarthak Mittal and the email I received have the same content written). That’s when it all clicked!⚠ Red Flags to Watch For:🚨 A rejection email followed by a paid service pitch.🚨 Being told your ATS score is too low and offered "help" for a fee.🚨 Recruiters redirecting you to Fiverr or paid platforms.🚨 Different names but the same tactics and email formats.💡 Lesson Learned? Never pay for job applications or resume fixes unless you’ve done your own research! There are plenty of free AI tools to improve your resume. Don’t let scammers profit off your job search struggles.Have you received similar emails? Let’s spread awareness and expose these scams together! Share your experiences in the comments. 🔍💬hashtag#EmailScam hashtag#JobScam hashtag#ScamAlert hashtag#CareerFraud hashtag#ResumeScam hashtag#ATSScam hashtag#StayAware hashtag#LinkedInCommunity

𝗠𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 .𝗡𝗘𝗧 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟭: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗮𝗯𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗤𝘂𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗲𝘀• Use proper indexing to speed up queries.• Avoid N+1 queries in EF Core by using .Include() wisely.• Use bulk updates without loading data with ExecuteUpdateAsync() (EF Core 7+).𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟮: 𝗥𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗲 𝗧𝗶𝗺𝗲• Enable Response Caching to store frequent API results.• Use Gzip or Brotli compression to reduce payload size.• Return only necessary data using DTOs instead of full models.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟯: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗖𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘀• Implement asynchronous processing (async/await) to prevent blocking.• Use IAsyncEnumerable<T> for streaming large data efficiently.• Apply rate limiting to prevent API abuse with AspNetCore.RateLimit.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟰: 𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝗖𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗛𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰 𝗔𝗣𝗜𝘀• Use Redis or In-Memory Caching to reduce database hits.• Cache query results to avoid expensive DB operations.• Implement ETag headers for caching API responses.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟱: 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗹𝘆• Use load balancers to distribute traffic.• Move heavy processing to background jobs (Hangfire, Worker Services).• Implement API Gateways for better routing and security.𝗣𝗿𝗼 𝗧𝗶𝗽: 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗼𝗿 & 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗼𝘂𝘀𝗹𝘆Use Application Insights, Serilog, or OpenTelemetry to track performance and fix bottlenecks.hashtag#Dotnet hashtag#Performance hashtag#Csharp hashtag#Backend hashtag#Api hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SeniorDeveloperTips

Microservice Roadmap Creating a roadmap for implementing microservices architecture involves several key phases and considerations.Microservice RoadmapPhase 1: Assessment and Planning1.Understand Business Goals:✅️Identify the business objectives that the microservices architecture will support.✅️Engage stakeholders to gather requirements and expectations.2.Evaluate Current Architecture:✅️Assess the existing system architecture.✅️Identify pain points and limitations of the monolithic system.3.Define Success Metrics:✅️Establish KPIs to measure the success of the microservices implementation.4.Skill Assessment:✅️Evaluate the current team’s skills in microservices, DevOps, and cloud technologies.✅️Identify training needs or hiring requirements.Phase 2: Design and Strategy5.Define Service Boundaries:✅️Identify logical boundaries for microservices based on business capabilities.✅️Use domain-driven design (DDD) principles to guide service decomposition.6.Select Technology Stack:✅️Choose appropriate languages, frameworks, and tools for developing microservices.✅️Consider containerization (e.g., Docker), orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes), and cloud platforms.7.Design APIs:✅️Define API contracts (REST, gRPC, GraphQL) for communication between services.✅️Ensure APIs are versioned and follow best practices.8.Establish Data Management Strategy:✅️Decide on data ownership for each service.✅️Choose between shared databases and database per service patterns.Phase 3: Development and Implementation9.Set Up CI/CD Pipeline:✅️Implement continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines for automating builds and deployments.10.Develop Microservices:✅️Start building microservices iteratively, focusing on high-priority services first.✅️Follow best practices for coding, testing, and documentation.11.Implement Service Discovery:✅️Choose a service discovery mechanism (e.g., Eureka, Consul) to facilitate communication between services.12.Establish Monitoring and Logging:✅️Implement centralized logging (e.g., ELK Stack) and monitoring (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana) for observability.Phase 4: Testing and Quality Assurance13.Automated Testing:✅️Develop unit, integration, and contract tests for microservices.✅️Implement service virtualization for testing inter-service interactions.14.Load and Performance Testing:✅️Conduct load testing to ensure services can handle expected traffic.15.Security Assessment:✅️Implement security best practices, including API security (OAuth2, JWT) and service-to-service authentication.💡Ultimately, successful microservices implementation is not just about technology but also about aligning with business goals, fostering a collaborative culture, and continuously improving processes.Want to know more? Securing the Future of the UK Food Industry: The Strategic Role of ApprenticeshipsWith the UK food and beverage sector employing over half a million people and contributing £38 billion to the economy annually, the industry’s success depends on a skilled, future-ready workforce. Yet, a national shortage of food scientists and technologists threatens long-term sustainability.Apprenticeships are emerging as a powerful solution—bridging the skills gap, fostering innovation, and providing businesses with a pipeline of specialized talent. Companies like Fera Science and Tesco are investing in structured training programs that equip the next generation with hands-on experience and industry-specific expertise. However, systemic change is needed. The proposed Growth and Skills Levy could play a pivotal role in reforming workforce development, ensuring apprenticeships remain a strategic asset for the sector.How can businesses and policymakers collaborate to enhance the impact of apprenticeships? ویدئو آموزشی به زبان فارسی و انگیسی را در کانال یوتوپ من دنبال کنید:https://lnkd.in/dcswikYbYou can also access the source code just here👇🔔🔔🔔https://lnkd.in/dCCgZ2JS🔆Sequential Execution🔆Pros:✅ Simple to understand✅ Practical execution order✅ Easy error handlingCons:❌ Slower overall execution❌ Waste potential parallel processing time❌ Each task must wait for previous completion🔆Parallel Execution🔆Pros:✅ Significantly faster overall execution✅ Tasks run concurrently✅ Better resource utilizationCons:❌ More complex error handling❌ Less control over execution order❌ Higher memory usage during concurrent execution💡When using Task.WhenAll, if any task throws an exception, it propagates to the await point. This pattern allows you to handle exceptions from multiple tasks while maintaining proper async behavior.Asynchronous methods are better for I/O-bound operations, while simple methods are suitable for CPU-bound tasks.You can have the experience of developing this pattern here just on my 💎YouTube channel👇🔔🔔🔔https://lnkd.in/dMxGSjA5hashtaghashtag#programming hashtaghashtag#learntocode hashtaghashtag#csharpproject hashtaghashtag#dotnet hashtaghashtag#async hashtaghashtag#await hashtaghashtag#csharp hashtaghashtag#coding hashtaghashtag#cancellation hashtaghashtag#cancellations hashtaghashtag#cancellationtoken hashtaghashtag#token hashtaghashtag#tokens hashtaghashtag#github hashtaghashtag#dotnet hashtaghashtag#aspnetcore hashtaghashtag#cleancodehashtag#taskhashtag#awaithashtag#async

Y, si no, que se vean esas ofertas. Que me hincho a rellenar mi perfil 4 mil veces en estos lugares web y luego no recibo ni una sola propuesta y, lo que es peor, ni una en condiciones ofrecida en ninguno de estos portales, por favor! Muchos incluso están vacíos, igual se busca robar nuestros datos para venderlos. Que yo aquí he aplicado a Volkswagen, Seur, Amazon, Loewe, es decir, a empresas reales, donde he estado pasando proceso de selección. ¿Cómo podéis decir que se pierde el tiempo cuando son procesos de verdad? Me parece de una carencia de ética absoluta, ojalá se os penalizara por eso. Y encima eso de "sin necesidad de hablar inglés". Jajaja, es alucinante...

### How to Easily Get a Remote Job Online The demand for remote jobs is skyrocketing! 🏡💻 If you want to earn well while working from home, following a few key strategies can help you succeed. ✅ **Develop the Right Skills** – Learn in-demand remote skills like graphic design, content writing, web development, digital marketing, or video editing. ✅ **Create a Professional Profile** – Build an attractive profile on platforms like LinkedIn, Upwork, Fiverr, and PeoplePerHour. Clearly highlight your experience and skills. ✅ **Network Effectively** – Networking is crucial for landing remote jobs. Stay active on LinkedIn, connect with industry experts, and share relevant posts. ✅ **Start with Small Projects** – Take on small projects initially, deliver quality work, and gradually increase your rates as you gain experience. ✅ **Maintain Professionalism** – Deliver work on time, build strong relationships with clients, and be open to feedback. 🎯 Start your remote job search today—your dream job might be waiting for you! 🚨 Job Offer or Scam? Beware of This Email Tactic!🚨 I recently received an email from Jennifer Brown offering me an internship or entry-level job opportunity. It seemed legitimate at first—they asked for my resume, reviewed it, and then rejected me. But what followed exposed the real motive behind this scheme!🔹 Jennifer emailed me again, saying, "Your resume was rejected due to a low ATS score, but I can connect you with someone who can improve it."🔹 When I agreed, she directed me to a Fiverr profile where I could "fix" my resume—for a price!🔹 This wasn’t the first time! A few weeks ago, I received a similar email from another person. I even reached out to their Fiverr contact, only to realize they were just selling paid resume reviews for $5–$10.This time, before I could fall for it again, I came across a LinkedIn post by Sarthak Mittal (CEO) exposing this scam (even the screenshot uploaded by Sarthak Mittal and the email I received have the same content written). That’s when it all clicked!⚠ Red Flags to Watch For:🚨 A rejection email followed by a paid service pitch.🚨 Being told your ATS score is too low and offered "help" for a fee.🚨 Recruiters redirecting you to Fiverr or paid platforms.🚨 Different names but the same tactics and email formats.💡 Lesson Learned? Never pay for job applications or resume fixes unless you’ve done your own research! There are plenty of free AI tools to improve your resume. Don’t let scammers profit off your job search struggles.Have you received similar emails? Let’s spread awareness and expose these scams together! Share your experiences in the comments. 🔍💬hashtag#EmailScam hashtag#JobScam hashtag#ScamAlert hashtag#CareerFraud hashtag#ResumeScam hashtag#ATSScam hashtag#StayAware hashtag#LinkedInCommunity

𝗠𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 .𝗡𝗘𝗧 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟭: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗮𝗯𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗤𝘂𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗲𝘀• Use proper indexing to speed up queries.• Avoid N+1 queries in EF Core by using .Include() wisely.• Use bulk updates without loading data with ExecuteUpdateAsync() (EF Core 7+).𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟮: 𝗥𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗲 𝗧𝗶𝗺𝗲• Enable Response Caching to store frequent API results.• Use Gzip or Brotli compression to reduce payload size.• Return only necessary data using DTOs instead of full models.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟯: 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗖𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘀• Implement asynchronous processing (async/await) to prevent blocking.• Use IAsyncEnumerable<T> for streaming large data efficiently.• Apply rate limiting to prevent API abuse with AspNetCore.RateLimit.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟰: 𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝗖𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗛𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰 𝗔𝗣𝗜𝘀• Use Redis or In-Memory Caching to reduce database hits.• Cache query results to avoid expensive DB operations.• Implement ETag headers for caching API responses.𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝟱: 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗲 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗹𝘆• Use load balancers to distribute traffic.• Move heavy processing to background jobs (Hangfire, Worker Services).• Implement API Gateways for better routing and security.𝗣𝗿𝗼 𝗧𝗶𝗽: 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗼𝗿 & 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗼𝘂𝘀𝗹𝘆Use Application Insights, Serilog, or OpenTelemetry to track performance and fix bottlenecks.hashtag#Dotnet hashtag#Performance hashtag#Csharp hashtag#Backend hashtag#Api hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SeniorDeveloperTips
